isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - LOWER CAB

step1.para: Be sure transmission shift lever is in neutral position and engine is shut off.
Return cab ram safety prop to its traveling position and secure in place ( Figure 11). If safety prop is stuck on the ram, raise cab slightly to release prop.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Cab Lift Ram and Cab Lift Lock, Right Side

step1.para: If cab was partially raised, remove alternate safety prop by raising cab slightly to release tension on safety prop, and remove prop.
If cab was at full tilt position while lowering cab, be sure transmission shift lever clears cab opening or damage could occur to the shift lever.
Place pump control valve lever in "LOWER" position and pump cab down against rear mounts. Visually inspect latch hooks to be sure they are fully engaged.
After cab is lowered and latched, place pump control lever in "RAISE" position momentarily and then return to "LOWER" position.
